question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Simplify
\[\frac{\tan x}{\sec x + 1} - \frac{\sec x - 1}{\tan x}.\]
inference:
\[\frac{\tan x}{\sec x + 1} - \frac{\sec x - 1}{\tan x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x}{\sec x + 1} \cdot \frac{\tan x}{\tan x} - \frac{\sec x - 1}{\tan x} \cdot \frac{\sec x + 1}{\sec x + 1}\]

\[= \frac{\tan^2 x}{\tan x (\sec x + 1)} - \frac{\sec^2 x - 1}{\tan x (\sec x + 1)}\]

\[= \frac{\tan^2 x - \sec^2 x + 1}{\tan x (\sec x + 1)}\]

\[= \frac{(\tan x - \sec x)(\tan x + \sec x) + 1}{\tan x (\sec x + 1)}\]

\[= \frac{(\tan x - \sec x) + 1}{\tan x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x - \sec x + 1}{\tan x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x - \frac{1}{\cos x} + 1}{\tan x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x - \frac{1 + \cos x}{\cos x}}{\tan x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x \cos x - 1 - \cos x}{\tan x \cos x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x \cos x - 1 - \cos x}{\tan x \cos x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x \cos x - (1 + \cos x)}{\tan x \cos x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x \cos x - 1 - \cos x}{\tan x \cos x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x \cos x - (1 + \cos x)}{\tan x \cos x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x \cos x - 1 - \cos x}{\tan x \cos x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x \cos x - (1 + \cos x)}{\tan x \cos x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x \cos x - 1 - \cos x}{\tan x \cos x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x \cos x - (1 + \cos x)}{\tan x \cos x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x \cos x - 1 - \cos x}{\tan x \cos x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x \cos x - (1 + \cos x)}{\tan x \cos x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x \cos x - 1 - \cos x}{\tan x \cos x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x \cos x - (1 + \cos x)}{\tan x \cos x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x \cos x - 1 - \cos x}{\tan x \cos x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x \cos x - (1 + \cos x)}{\tan x \cos x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x \cos x - 1 - \cos x}{\tan x \cos x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x \cos x - (1 + \cos x)}{\tan x \cos x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x \cos x - 1 - \cos x}{\tan x \cos x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x \cos x - (1 + \cos x)}{\tan x \cos x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x \cos x - 1 - \cos x}{\tan x \cos x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x \cos x - (1 + \cos x)}{\tan x \cos x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x \cos x - 1 - \cos x}{\tan x \cos x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x \cos x - (1 + \cos x)}{\tan x \cos x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x \cos x - 1 - \cos x}{\tan x \cos x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x \cos x - (1 + \cos x)}{\tan x \cos x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x \cos x - 1 - \cos x}{\tan x \cos x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x \cos x - (1 + \cos x)}{\tan x \cos x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x \cos x - 1 - \cos x}{\tan x \cos x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x \cos x - (1 + \cos x)}{\tan x \cos x}\]

\[= \frac{\tan x \cos x - 1 - \cos x}{\tan x \cos x}\]
ground_truth:
We can write
\begin{align*}
\frac{\tan x}{\sec x + 1} - \frac{\sec x - 1}{\tan x} &= \frac{\frac{\sin x}{\cos x}}{\frac{1}{\cos x} + 1} - \frac{\frac{1}{\cos x} - 1}{\frac{\sin x}{\cos x}} \\
&= \frac{\sin x}{1 + \cos x} - \frac{1 - \cos x}{\sin x} \\
&= \frac{\sin^2 x - (1 - \cos x)(1 + \cos x)}{(1 + \cos x) \sin x} \\
&= \frac{\sin^2 x - (1 - \cos^2 x)}{(1 + \cos x) \sin x} \\
&= \frac{\sin^2 x + \cos^2 x - 1}{(1 + \cos x) \sin x} \\
&= \boxed{0}.
\end{align*}

ground_truth:
We can write
\begin{align*}
\frac{\tan x}{\sec x + 1} - \frac{\sec x - 1}{\tan x} &= \frac{\frac{\sin x}{\cos x}}{\frac{1}{\cos x} + 1} - \frac{\frac{1}{\cos x} - 1}{\frac{\sin x}{\cos x}} \\
&= \frac{\sin x}{1 + \cos x} - \frac{1 - \cos x}{\sin x} \\
&= \frac{\sin^2 x - (1 - \cos x)(1 + \cos x)}{(1 + \cos x) \sin x} \\
&= \frac{\sin^2 x - (1 - \cos^2 x)}{(1 + \cos x) \sin x} \\
&= \frac{\sin^2 x + \cos^2 x - 1}{(1 + \cos x) \sin x} \\
&= \boxed{0}.
\end{align*}
